text: Shawbury is a village and civil parish in Shropshire, England. It is 8.4 miles (13.5 km) north east of Shrewsbury, the county town, 11.5 miles (18.5 km) north west of Telford and 163 miles (262 km) north west of London. The 2011 census revealed the parish had 2,872 residents. The village is recorded in the 1085 Domesday Book. In the book, it is called Sawesberie. The A53 between Shrewsbury and Market Drayton goes through the village. The village has a Co- operative shop, a pub, a church, a chip shop and a Chinese takeaway. It is home to RAF Shawbury, a Royal Air Force base. ==Gallery== File:Shawbury_parish_church_from_the_village_centre.jpg|Church Street File:RAF Shawbury - geograph.org.uk - 658177.jpg|RAF Shawbury File:Entering_the_village_-_geograph.org.uk_-_774460.jpg|Houses in Shawbury Category:Villages in Shropshire Category:Civil parishes in Shropshire
title: Shawbury
